API Documentation for User Service¶

app.py¶

class app.Home¶

This Resource serves as a welcome message if the user goes to the web server root

get()¶

The GET request handler for this resource.

Returns

None

class app.UserAdd¶

This Resource helps to add a new user to the database, including the user’s first name, last name, email ID and phone number

post()¶

The POST request handler for this resource.

Returns

the JSON object containing the status message of the operation

class app.UserAddEmail¶

This Resource helps to add an additional email ID for the user

post()¶

The POST request handler for the resource

Returns

JSON object containing the status message of the operation

class app.UserAddPhone¶

This Resource helps to add an additional phone number for user

post()¶

The POST request handler for the resource

Returns

JSON containing status message of the operation

class app.UserDelete¶

This Resource helps to delete a user from the database. Please note that when a User is deleted, its associated Email and PhoneNumber objects also need to be deleted from the db.

delete()¶

The DELETE request handler for this resource.

Returns

the JSON object containing the status message of the operation

class app.UserGetByID¶

This Resource returns details of a user by providing user id

get(id)¶

The GET request handler

Parameters

id – the user id

Returns

json object containing user info

class app.UserGetByName¶

This Resource returns the user info by providing the user name (first name and last name). Note that there could be multiple users with same first and last name.

get()¶

The GET request handler

Returns

list containing JSON object for each user

class app.UserUpdateMail¶

This Resource helps to update an existing email of the user

put()¶

The PUT request handler for this resource. We are using HTTP PUT here since we only need to modify an existing data.

Returns

the JSON object containing the status message of the operation

class app.UserUpdatePhone¶

This Resource helps to update an existing phone number of the user

put()¶

The PUT request handler for this resource.

Returns

the JSON object containing the status message for this operation

app.create_app(config_file)¶

The application factory to create multiple instances of Flask app

Parameters

config_file – the config file used for Flask

Returns

the application instance

models.py¶

class models.Email(mail, user_id)¶

The Email model (table)

class models.PhoneNumber(number, user_id)¶

The PhoneNumber model (table)

class models.User(last_name, first_name)¶

The User model (table)
